questions.question: _____ is a set of acceptable behaviors for using a computer and the Internet.
Internet is a vast storehouse of information. Programs used to search information are called _____.
_____ refers to the online communication platform used for interaction, content sharing, and collaboration.
E-commerce means buying and selling of _____ and services online.
_____ refers to an unwanted, unsolicited, and useless e-mail.
_____ is a malicious program that attacks a computer and harms the users' data.
_____ refers to the act of using or imitating others' ideas and works without acknowledging the source.
Mentioning an acknowledgment of the source of used information is called _____.
_____ is an act of threatening, harassing, or embarrassing a person using the Internet or mobile phones.
Searching the whereabouts of a person you meet online is called _____.
_____ refers to gaining unauthorized access to a computer and/or network resources.
A person who does hacking is called a _____ or a cracker.
A hacker who breaks into systems to fix flaws and improve security is called a _____ hat hacker.
A cracker who gains unauthorized access for stealing data is also called a _____ hat hacker.
Programs that can read keystrokes pressed on a keyboard to steal confidential information are called _____.
A _____ is a network security program that keeps a check on incoming and outgoing information.
An _____ program is used to prevent, detect, and remove malicious software.
_____ is a type of Internet fraud that tricks people into revealing sensitive information.
_____ is a fraudulent act of using phone calls or voice messages to steal confidential information.
A secured website URL starts with _____ and shows a closed lock icon.
Sending e-mail that appears to have originated from one source when it was sent from another is called _____.
Repeatedly sending the same e-mail to a particular address is called _____.
Sending requests to a computer resource many times more than it can handle is called _____.
A _____ is a small piece of data that collects information of your online activity and reports to the host.
COPPA stands for Children's Online Privacy _____ Act.
_____ piracy is an act of illegal copying of a software without buying the license or copyright.
_____ laws protect creative works such as books, movies, music, and software.
A _____ is a word, name, or symbol used to identify and distinguish products of one manufacturer from others.
A _____ is a legal right that gives the creator the sole right to make, use, and sell an invention.
A _____ secret is non-public information about commercial practices owned by a business.
Any illegal activity conducted through the use of a computer and the Internet is called _____.
Cybercrime is punishable under _____ Acts enacted in most countries.
The information about a user that exists on the Internet as a result of their online activity is called _____.
The length of a strong password should be at least _____ to 10 characters.
You should change your password at least once every _____.
The _____ program surveys your Internet behavior and copies your passwords to use them for illegitimate purposes.
An _____ program places advertisements in your browser and allows pop-ups.
_____ is an act of using the Internet to stalk or harass a person by labeling false accusations.
Cyber _____ or cyber espionage is obtaining secrets without the permission of the holder of information.
_____ is a phishing technique where a user is tricked into clicking on something malicious.
Google Chrome, Internet Explorer, and Mozilla Firefox are examples of web _____.
Facebook, LinkedIn, and WhatsApp are examples of _____ media platforms.
The social media platform formerly known as Twitter is now called _____.
Skype and Google Duo are examples of _____ conferencing programs.
Norton, MacAfee, Kaspersky, and Quick Heal are examples of _____ software.
Internet is an integral part of modern _____.
Schools and universities offer virtual _____ on the Internet.
Users can watch movies, listen to music, and play games on the Internet for _____.
Email, chat, instant messenger, and telephony are modes of _____ on the Internet.
People often get _____ to the Internet and waste useful time.
Malware spreads much faster through the Internet because of large number of files and _____ being shared.
Kids like to share videos, photos, and other files, which can lead to careless sharing of personal _____.
We should remain honest, respect views of others, and acknowledge the _____ of people on the Internet.
Do not copy or use _____ software for which you have not paid.
Do not claim _____ on a work which is the output of someone else's work.
If you have developed software to share online, think about the _____ impact it can have.
Plagiarism is a serious _____ that results in severe penalties.
Using information from Internet requires obtaining written permission from the _____ owner.
Cyberbullying can be very stressful to the victim, especially children, and can cause _____ issues.
If being cyberbullied, you should Stop, _____, and Tell.
Don't be an _____: Don't be silent, take a stand against cyberbullying.
Hackers should have _____ permission from computer or network owners to hack into the system.
Hackers and crackers can damage users' social reputation and _____ apart from causing data and financial losses.
Keep your operating system and web browser updated to the _____ version.
Older versions of software may have _____ that could be easily misused.
Phishing is conducted through forged emails that claim to be sent by well-known _____.
Phishing emails often promote _____ and lure users into revealing their private credentials.
Banks will _____ ask you to send your password or personal information by email.
Problems caused by spamming include wastage of time, wastage of network _____, and malware infection.
Use the spam _____ of your email program to block unwanted emails.
A person has the right to determine what information about them is collected and how that information is _____.
You can protect online privacy by disabling _____ in the web browser settings.
COPPA is a law to protect the privacy of children under _____ years of age.
When you purchase original software, you become a _____ user of the software.
You cannot install copies of software on extra computers or give _____ copies to your friends.
Intellectual Property Rights protect the interests of the _____ of creations.
Copyright laws protect creative works such as books, movies, music, paintings, photographs, and _____.
Trademark rights protect the owners of a particular company or a _____.
An industrial design right identifies objects by their appearance, _____, or design.
Cybercrime includes identity theft, forgery, defamation, mischief, and credit card account _____.
A cybercrime is punishable with _____ and heavy monetary fine.
Cyber trafficking may deal in drugs, weapons, other contrabands, and even _____.
Cyberterrorism causes loss of _____ or intimidation through threat.
For sensitive information, use the 'private' or '_____' mode of the web browser.
Delete the _____ of your web browser periodically.
Clear the _____ of your web browser regularly.
Do not share your personal information without your _____'s permission.
If working on a public computer, make sure you _____ properly.
Do not agree to meet an online friend without your parent's _____.
Many social networking sites prescribe a minimum _____ limit for membership.
Password is the most common _____ method used to protect user's identity.
A password should consist of alphabets in lowercase, uppercase, digits, and _____ characters.
Do not use your name, family member's name, or date of _____ as password.
Avoid typing your password while someone is looking over your _____.
Don't check the _____ Password option on public computers.
Don't check the Stay _____ in option when working on public computers.
Digital footprint can make or break your _____ in the cyber world.
Whatever you do online persists and establishes your online _____.
To establish online identity, use your real name and do not hide with _____ identity.
Some companies search the candidate's online _____ before giving the job.
